task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 88°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to estimate the height of the building, but I cannot see the top, so I will look up to get a full view of the structure.
I seem to have rotated incorrectly and am now facing a different direction; I need to turn back to the east (approx. 88°) to see the target building again.
I am back at the starting position and still cannot see the top of the building, so I will tilt my view upwards to see the full structure.
The system seems to reset my heading to 0° North whenever I adjust the pitch; I need to rotate back to the East (90°) and then try adjusting the pitch again to see the top of the building.
I am now facing the correct building again, so I will attempt to look up to see the top of the structure to estimate its height.
The system is malfunctioning and resetting my heading to North whenever I try to look up; I will try to set both heading and pitch simultaneously to face the building and look up in a single command.
I can now see the top of the building, so I will look down to see the base and get a complete view for my height estimation.
The system has reset my heading again; I need to rotate back to the East (90°) and look down at a less extreme angle to see the base of the building clearly.

Having viewed both the top and bottom of the building, I can now estimate its height; it appears to be about 10-12 stories tall, and assuming a standard floor height of 3.5-4 meters, I estimate the total height to be around 45 meters.
